tar.h

00001 /*
00002  * Header file for public domain tar (tape archive) program.
00003  *
00004  * @(#)tar.h 1.20 86/10/29  Public Domain.
00005  *
00006  * Created 25 August 1985 by John Gilmore, ihnp4!hoptoad!gnu.
00007  *
00008  * $Id: tar.h,v 1.5 1999/01/13 15:44:10 christos Exp $ # checkin only
00009  */
00010 
00011 /*
00012  * Kludge for handling systems that can't cope with multiple
00013  * external definitions of a variable.  In ONE routine (tar.c),
00014  * we #define TAR_EXTERN to null; here, we set it to "extern" if
00015  * it is not already set.
00016  */
00017 #ifndef TAR_EXTERN
00018 #define TAR_EXTERN extern
00019 #endif
00020 
00021 /*
00022  * Header block on tape.
00023  *
00024  * I'm going to use traditional DP naming conventions here.
00025  * A "block" is a big chunk of stuff that we do I/O on.
00026  * A "record" is a piece of info that we care about.
00027  * Typically many "record"s fit into a "block".
00028  */
00029 #define RECORDSIZE  512
00030 #define NAMSIZ  100
00031 #define TUNMLEN 32
00032 #define TGNMLEN 32
00033 
00034 union record {
00035     char        charptr[RECORDSIZE];
00036     struct header {
00037         char    name[NAMSIZ];
00038         char    mode[8];
00039         char    uid[8];
00040         char    gid[8];
00041         char    size[12];
00042         char    mtime[12];
00043         char    chksum[8];
00044         char    linkflag;
00045         char    linkname[NAMSIZ];
00046         char    magic[8];
00047         char    uname[TUNMLEN];
00048         char    gname[TGNMLEN];
00049         char    devmajor[8];
00050         char    devminor[8];
00051     } header;
00052 };
00053 
00054 /* The checksum field is filled with this while the checksum is computed. */
00055 #define CHKBLANKS   "        "  /* 8 blanks, no null */
00056 
00057 /* The magic field is filled with this if uname and gname are valid. */
00058 #define TMAGIC      "ustar  "   /* 7 chars and a null */
00059 
00060 /* The linkflag defines the type of file */
00061 #define LF_OLDNORMAL    '\0'        /* Normal disk file, Unix compat */
00062 #define LF_NORMAL   '0'     /* Normal disk file */
00063 #define LF_LINK     '1'     /* Link to previously dumped file */
00064 #define LF_SYMLINK  '2'     /* Symbolic link */
00065 #define LF_CHR      '3'     /* Character special file */
00066 #define LF_BLK      '4'     /* Block special file */
00067 #define LF_DIR      '5'     /* Directory */
00068 #define LF_FIFO     '6'     /* FIFO special file */
00069 #define LF_CONTIG   '7'     /* Contiguous file */
00070 /* Further link types may be defined later. */
00071 
00072 /*
00073  * Exit codes from the "tar" program
00074  */
00075 #define EX_SUCCESS  0       /* success! */
00076 #define EX_ARGSBAD  1       /* invalid args */
00077 #define EX_BADFILE  2       /* invalid filename */
00078 #define EX_BADARCH  3       /* bad archive */
00079 #define EX_SYSTEM   4       /* system gave unexpected error */
00080 
00081 
00082 /*
00083  * Global variables
00084  */
00085 TAR_EXTERN union record *ar_block;  /* Start of block of archive */
00086 TAR_EXTERN union record *ar_record; /* Current record of archive */
00087 TAR_EXTERN union record *ar_last;   /* Last+1 record of archive block */
00088 TAR_EXTERN char     ar_reading; /* 0 writing, !0 reading archive */
00089 TAR_EXTERN int      blocking;   /* Size of each block, in records */
00090 TAR_EXTERN int      blocksize;  /* Size of each block, in bytes */
00091 TAR_EXTERN char     *ar_file;   /* File containing archive */
00092 TAR_EXTERN char     *name_file; /* File containing names to work on */
00093 TAR_EXTERN char     *tar;       /* Name of this program */
00094 
00095 /*
00096  * Flags from the command line
00097  */
00098 TAR_EXTERN char f_reblock;      /* -B */
00099 TAR_EXTERN char f_create;       /* -c */
00100 TAR_EXTERN char f_debug;        /* -d */
00101 TAR_EXTERN char f_sayblock;     /* -D */
00102 TAR_EXTERN char f_follow_links;     /* -h */
00103 TAR_EXTERN char f_ignorez;      /* -i */
00104 TAR_EXTERN char f_keep;         /* -k */
00105 TAR_EXTERN char f_modified;     /* -m */
00106 TAR_EXTERN char f_oldarch;      /* -o */
00107 TAR_EXTERN char f_use_protection;   /* -p */
00108 TAR_EXTERN char f_sorted_names;     /* -s */
00109 TAR_EXTERN char f_list;         /* -t */
00110 TAR_EXTERN char f_namefile;     /* -T */
00111 TAR_EXTERN char f_verbose;      /* -v */
00112 TAR_EXTERN char f_extract;      /* -x */
00113 TAR_EXTERN char f_compress;     /* -z */
00114 
00115 /*
00116  * We now default to Unix Standard format rather than 4.2BSD tar format.
00117  * The code can actually produce all three:
00118  *  f_standard  ANSI standard
00119  *  f_oldarch   V7
00120  *  neither     4.2BSD
00121  * but we don't bother, since 4.2BSD can read ANSI standard format anyway.
00122  * The only advantage to the "neither" option is that we can cmp(1) our
00123  * output to the output of 4.2BSD tar, for debugging.
00124  */
00125 #define     f_standard      (!f_oldarch)
00126 
00127 /*
00128  * Structure for keeping track of filenames and lists thereof.
00129  */
00130 struct name {
00131     struct name *next;
00132     short       length;
00133     char        found;
00134     char        name[NAMSIZ+1];
00135 };
00136 
00137 TAR_EXTERN struct name  *namelist;  /* Points to first name in list */
00138 TAR_EXTERN struct name  *namelast;  /* Points to last name in list */
00139 
00140 TAR_EXTERN int      archive;    /* File descriptor for archive file */
00141 TAR_EXTERN int      errors;     /* # of files in error */
00142 
00143 /*
00144  *
00145  * Due to the next struct declaration, each routine that includes
00146  * "tar.h" must also include <sys/types.h>.  I tried to make it automatic,
00147  * but System V has no defines in <sys/types.h>, so there is no way of
00148  * knowing when it has been included.  In addition, it cannot be included
00149  * twice, but must be included exactly once.  Argghh!
00150  *
00151  * Thanks, typedef.  Thanks, USG.
00152  */
00153 struct link {
00154     struct link *next;
00155     dev_t       dev;
00156     ino_t       ino;
00157     short       linkcount;
00158     char        name[NAMSIZ+1];
00159 };
00160 
00161 TAR_EXTERN struct link  *linklist;  /* Points to first link in list */
00162 
00163 
00164 /*
00165  * Error recovery stuff
00166  */
00167 TAR_EXTERN char     read_error_flag;
00168

00172  * Declarations of functions available to the world.
00173  */
00174 /*LINTLIBRARY*/
00175 #define  annorec(stream, msg)   anno(stream, msg, 0)    /* Cur rec */
00176 #define annofile(stream, msg)   anno(stream, msg, 1)    /* Saved rec */
00177 #endif
